H0.text: Ovarian stem cells are the type of stem cells that begin oogenesis, which is gametogenesis in females.

H1.text: Secretion is the type of stem cells with which oogenesis, the gametogenesis in females, begins.

H2.text: Digestive stem cells are the type of stem cells with which oogenesis, the gametogenesis in females, begins.

H3.text: Uterian cells are the type of stem cells with which oogenesis, which is gametogenesis in females, begins.

A4.text: Using fluorescent proteins to label the OSCs, scientists have demonstrated OSCs that can form primordial follicles that are capable of further growth and development.

A5.text: The structure and characteristics of ovarian stem cells are controversial, since there is currently no definitive evidence that they exist.

A6.text: Removal and cryopreservation of OSCs from female patients prior to ovotoxic treatments such as chemotherapy, and subsequent replacement into the patient's ovary, has been proposed as a way to allow women to produce their own oocytes and conceive their own child after follicle-depleting treatment.

A7.text: Re-injection of OSCs into the ovary following menopause may restore the population of hormone secreting oocytes, restoring endocrine function in the ovary and resulting in the reversal of the unpleasant symptoms of menopause.
